Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2024/0335 b) Date of Occurrence: 25/08/2024
c) Installation Details: Sentinel-15 - AC-9880-715 at Sector
South Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Pneumatic b) Date Component 01/09/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Pneumatic Starter d) Main Assembly: Pylon-B
e) Nomenclature: Pneumatic Starter Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-B
g) Part No.: PN-8078-W9 h) Sl No.: SN-1000-241
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 25/04/2020 l) Date of Removal: 31/08/2024
Pg No: 50 Ln No: 23 Pg No: 27 Ln No: 1
m) Manufacturing Agency: Precision Avionics Corp n) Date, Month & Year September 2020
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 4063 Hrs / 1272 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Outflow valve control malfunction. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Environmental exposure causing accelerated degradation of protective coatings
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Pneumatic Starter component.
Functional testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Update software to latest certified version with bug fixes
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Update technical documentation with lessons learned
d) Attributable Code: N1 - Defect confirmed but reason not established
Remarks: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 08/09/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Manufacturing quality documentation reviewed. No deviations noted. Concur with investigation findings.
Date: 10/09/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User perspective considered. Recommend update to operating procedures based on lessons learned.
Date: 10/09/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality assurance framework assessed. Investigation process followed established protocols. Findings are valid.
Date: 14/09/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design authority review completed. Recommend continued airworthiness monitoring of affected component type.
Date: 15/09/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
